titleStmt.title: Nehushtan, or, A sober and peaceable discourse, concerning the abolishing of things abused to superstition and idolatry which may serve as one intire, and sufficient argument, to evince that the liturgy, ceremonies, and other things used at this day in the Church of England, ought neither to be imposed, nor retained, but utterly extirpated and laid aside : and to vindicate the non-conformists in their refusal to close with them.
titleStmt.author: Wilson, Joseph, d. 1678.

titleStmt.title: Nehushtan, or, A sober and peaceable discourse, concerning the abolishing of things abused to superstition and idolatry which may serve as one intire, and sufficient argument, to evince that the liturgy, ceremonies, and other things used at this day in the Church of England, ought neither to be imposed, nor retained, but utterly extirpated and laid aside : and to vindicate the non-conformists in their refusal to close with them.
titleStmt.author: Wilson, Joseph, d. 1678.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Wilson by Wing and NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Imperfect: faded and stained, with some loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
